text: The 14th Kelantan State election will be held on or before 23 August 2018. The previous state election was held on 5 May 2013. The state assemblymen is elected to 5 years term each. The Kelantan State Legislative Assembly would automatically dissolve on 13 June 2018, the fifth anniversary of the first sitting, and elections must be held within sixty days (two months) of the dissolution (on or before 13 August 2018, with the date to be decided by the Election Commission), unless dissolved prior to that date by the Head of State (Sultan of Kelantan) on the advice of the Head of Government (Menteri Besar of Kelantan). ==Contenders== Barisan Nasional (BN) is set to contest all 45 seats in Kelantan State Legislative Assembly. Barisan Nasional (BN) linchpin party United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) is to set to contest major share of Barisan Nasional (BN) seats. Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party (PAS) is set to contest all 45 seats in Kelantan to defend their victory in the last election . Pakatan Harapan have decided to contest all 45 seats in Kelantan. However, Pakatan Harapan has yet to finalize 14 seats at the moment. The seats are including Demit, Kemahang, Kemuning, Tawang and Kijang.14 kerusi tak sepakat, HARAPAN Kelantan bawa ke pusat On 1 March 2018, Pakatan Harapan has completed the distribution of seats in Kelantan. National Trust Party (Amanah) will contest in 23 seats while the Malaysian United Indigenous Party (Bersatu) will have 11 seats. People's Justice Party (PKR) will contest 10 seats while the Democratic Action Party (DAP) will contest a single seat, which is in Galas.HARAPAN Kelantan selesai agih kerusi Parti Sosialis Malaysia (PSM) will contest in Kota Lama.PSM umum calon 5 kerusi parlimen, 12 DUN === Political parties === {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" |Coalition ! rowspan="2" |Other parties |- !Incumbent ! colspan="2" |Opposition |- |Gagasan Sejahtera (GS) |Barisan Nasional (BN) |50x50px Pakatan Harapan (PH) | rowspan="2" | * 50x50px Socialist Party of Malaysia (Parti Sosialis Malaysia) PSM mahu bertanding di DUN Kota Lama, Kelantan |- | * 45x45px Malaysian Islamic Party (PAS) | * 45x45px United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) * 45x45px Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) | * 50x50px National Trust Party (Amanah) * 50x50px Malaysian United Indigenous Party (Bersatu) * 50x50px People's Justice Party (PKR) * 50x50px Democratic Action Party (DAP) |} ==The contested seats== {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="3" |No. ! rowspan="3" |State constituency ! rowspan="3" |Incumbent State Assemblyman ! colspan="8" |Political parties |- !colspan="2" |40x40px Gagasan Sejahtera !colspan="2" | Barisan Nasional Tok Pa akan pertahan dua kerusi disandangnya !colspan="2" |50x50px Pakatan Harapan PAN fokus menang di kerusi kubu kuat PAS !colspan="2" |Other parties/Ind |- |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |Candidate Name |Party |- |N01 |Pengkalan Kubor |Mat Razi Mat Ail (BN) |Wan Roslan Wan Hamat |rowspan="46" |PAS |Mat Razi Mat Ail |rowspan="8" |UMNO |Wan Rosdi Mat Rasik |PKR | | |- |N02 |Kelaboran |Mohamad Zaki Ibrahim (GS) |Mohd Adenan Hassan |Hashim Mohamad |Nik Faezah Nik Othman |Amanah | | |- |N03 |Pasir Pekan |Ahmad Yaakob (GS) |Ahmad Yaakob |Wan Mohd Sanusi Wan Yunus |Wan Johari Wan Omar |Bersatu | | |- |N04 |Wakaf Bharu |Che Abdullah Mat Nawi (GS) |Mohd Rusli Abdullah |Mohd Rosdi Ab Aziz |Mohd. The government side has 6 safe seats and 5 fairly safe seats.
